The video was published here on Facebook on May 8, 2020. It has been viewed more than 638,000 times and shared about 18,300 times.
The 24-second clip shows a chained man led out of a building before he appears to be shot multiple times. He is then seen falling on the ground before uniformed officers carry him into a vehicle.

The post’s Urdu-language caption translates to English as: “Heard that this man was going to testify against Asif Ali Zardari. How cleverly he has been removed from the way. What role for police has been left in this matter now?”
The video was also shared here, here, here, here, here, here and here on Facebook; and here, here and here on Twitter alongside a similar claim.
The claim, however, is false; the video was filmed for a Pakistani television drama.
A keyword search found this video on Twitter which appears to show the purportedly fallen man in conversation with another person.

A voice in the video says: “He is the gentleman who was hit by a bullet, but he is standing alive. He is Mithun Chakraborty. Bullet does not do any harm to him. How did you feel after being hit by a bullet?”
The bloodied man responds: “It felt fantastic. It felt ok to me.”
Mithun Chakraborty is an award-winning Indian actor, according to the US entertainment online database IMDb.
Below are screenshot comparisons of keyframes taken from the video in the tweet (L) and the misleading Facebook post (R), with the actor circled red:
AFP also found comments on the misleading Facebook post which suggested the video was a scene filmed for the 2018 Pakistani television drama Haara Dil.
A further keyword search found this clip published on the YouTube channel of A Plus Entertainment, which appears to show the broadcast version of the same scene.
The video, dated September 13, 2018, is titled: “Haara Dil - Episode 23 | Aplus Dramas | Danish Taimoor, Hiba Bukhari | Pakistani Drama”.
At the three-minute 46-second mark of the video, Chakraborty can be seen in the same shooting scene.
